title: Cleanup/align mentor fav
body_html:
Hey @carpodaster,

we had some misunderstandings when preparing the rating views about how mentor_fav and sign_off work when being revoked (rails-girls-summer-of-code/selection_process#57).
In my personal opinion, it makes sense to align their behavior and just fully reset them to nil (as in just removing the key from the hash as if nothing ever happened) or do you see a value in having a "false" string there instead?

I also added one of these one-off rake tasks to correct the production data.

body:
Hey @carpodaster,

we had some misunderstandings when preparing the rating views about how `mentor_fav` and `sign_off` work when being revoked (rails-girls-summer-of-code/selection_process#57).
In my personal opinion, it makes sense to align their behavior and just fully *reset* them to `nil` (as in just removing the key from the hash as if nothing ever happened) or do you see a value in having a `"false"` string there instead?

I also added one of these one-off rake tasks to correct the production data.
